title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.001
frontText: What file extension is used for comma‐separated values files?
backText: .csv

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.002
frontText: When you import a text file, what appears?
backText: Text Import Wizard

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.003
frontText: How do you write cells in a comma‐separated values file?
backText: Using a comma and no spaces after each comma, such as: Product,January,February,March

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.004
frontText: When you search, what wildcard character do you use to find all characters between two specific characters?
backText: The asterisk (*)

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.005
frontText: How do you go to a new location in your workbook quickly?
backText: Press Ctrl+G to open the Go To dialog box.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.006
frontText: What does the cell reference E13 represent?
backText: The cell in column E, row 13

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.007
frontText: What are the types of hyperlinks that you can add in a workbook?
backText: To another cell or range in a workbook, an existing file, to a web page, and to an email address

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.008
frontText: How do you add a page break to a worksheet?
backText: Click the Page Layout menu option, click Breaks in the Page Layout ribbon, and then choose Insert Page Break from the drop‐down menu.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.009
frontText: How wide can a column be?
backText: 255 points wide

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.010
frontText: How does the worksheet view change when you add a header or footer?
backText: You see the workbook in Page Layout view.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.011
frontText: How many sections are there in a header or a footer?
backText: Three

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.012
frontText: What are the four default options in the Quick Access Toolbar?
backText: AutoSave, Save, Undo, and Redo

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.013
frontText: What are the three types of custom views that you can add?
backText: Display settings, print settings, and a specific print area

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.014
frontText: In a cell, how do you change between showing the result and the formula quickly?
backText: Press Ctrl+` (the grave accent) on the keyboard.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.015
frontText: Why would you need to inspect a document?
backText: To ensure that you don’t share any personal information and that everyone can read the document no matter their accessibility needs and/or Excel version

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.016
frontText: What happens when you paste only a value from one cell into another cell?
backText: Only the value appears in the new cell without formatting from the copied cell.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.017
frontText: When you need to select 8 rows to delete starting at row 3, what row is the last row to select?
backText: Row 10

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.018
frontText: How do you merge text in several cells in a row but keep the text aligned to the left of the merged cells?
backText: Click the down arrow to the right of Merge & Center in the Home ribbon, and then click Merge Across.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.019
frontText: How do you apply formatting from one cell to another quickly?
backText: Using Format Painter

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.020
frontText: How do you add a line break in a cell quickly?
backText: Pressing Alt+Enter

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.021
frontText: What are the six options for formatting cells?
backText: Number, Alignment, Font, Border, Fill, and Protection

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.022
frontText: What is a range?
backText: A selected group of cells

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.023
frontText: What are the three types of Sparkline charts?
backText: Line, Column, and Win/Loss

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.024
frontText: What are the six types Quick Analysis format types?
backText: Data Bars, Colors, Icon Set, Greater, Top 10%, and Clear

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.025
frontText: How do you add a table into a worksheet?
backText: Select the range, click the Home menu option, and then click Format As Table in the Home ribbon.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.026
frontText: How do you apply a table style quickly?
backText: Click the style tile in the Table Design ribbon.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.027
frontText: What are the styles that you can turn off and on in the Table Design ribbon?
backText: Header Row, Total Row, Banded Rows, First Column, Last Column, Banded Columns, and Filter Button

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.028
frontText: What is a common reason for sorting a table?
backText: To sort the first letters of text within a column in alphabetical or numerical order

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.029
frontText: What does it mean to sort in descending order?
backText: To sort the first letters of text in a column from Z to A or numbers from largest to smallest

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.030
frontText: What type of cell reference is $A$5 in a formula?
backText: Absolute

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.031
frontText: How do you change cell reference types quickly in the Formula Bar?
backText: Pressing F4

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.032
frontText: How do you add a table into a SUM() formula quickly?
backText: With the parentheses in the formula, start typing the name of the table and then choose the table name from the drop‐down list.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.033
frontText: What are the four types of calculations?
backText: AVERAGE(), MAX(), MIN(), SUM()

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.034
frontText: How many numbers can you add to a calculation function?

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.035
frontText: What does the MAX() function do?
backText: Returns the largest number within the selected cells

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.036
frontText: What does the MIN() function do?
backText: Returns the smallest number in the selected cells

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.037
frontText: When you average cells with numbers and one cell is blank, how does Excel treat that cell?
backText: Excel treats the cell as having the number 0.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.038
frontText: How do you count a group of cells?
backText: Type COUNT( and then the group of cells, such as B4:B12, into the formula.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.039
frontText: How many numbers can you add into the COUNTA() formula?

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.040
frontText: Which counting function do you use to count the number of empty cells in a range?
backText: COUNTBLANK()

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.041
frontText: What are you trying to do when you add an IF() function to a formula?
backText: Determine whether the text or value in a cell meets the required criteria.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.042
frontText: When you add an IF() function, what is the result?
backText: Either TRUE or FALSE depending on the criteria

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.043
frontText: What does the formula RIGHT(C3,4) return?
backText: The last four characters in cell C3

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.044
frontText: When you use the RIGHT(), LEFT(), and MID() functions, how does Excel treat a space?
backText: Excel treats the space as a character.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.045
frontText: How do you copy text in a cell and convert it to all uppercase letters when you paste the text in a new cell?
backText: Using the UPPER() function in the formula within the new cell

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.046
frontText: What happens when you type =LOWER(A2) into cell B2?
backText: The text in cell A2 appears in all lowercase letters in cell B2.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.047
frontText: What does the LEN() function do?
backText: It tells you how many characters are in a cell.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.048
frontText: What new text joining function is available in Excel 2019 and the latest version of Excel for Microsoft 365?
backText: TEXTJOIN()

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.049
frontText: When you copy a range of cells into a new range, how do you resize the column width in the new cells to match the width of the copied cells?
backText: Click the Paste icon in the Home menu ribbon, and then click the Column Widths icon in the Paste drop‐down menu.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.050
frontText: When you join text in cells into a new cell, how many characters can that new cell have?

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.051
frontText: How do you add a chart starting with chart styles that Excel recommends?
backText: Select the cells to add to the chart, click the Insert menu option, and then click Recommended Charts in the Insert ribbon.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.052
frontText: How do you move a chart into a chart sheet?
backText: Select the chart, click the Chart Design menu option, and then click Move Chart in the Chart Design ribbon.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.053
frontText: What is a data series?
backText: One or more rows and/or columns in a worksheet or table that Excel uses to build a chart

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.054
frontText: Does Excel automatically place columns or rows in the horizontal axis?
backText: Columns, but only if there are fewer rows than columns

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.055
frontText: What information does Excel place into a chart by default?
backText: Axes, axis titles, and the default chart title name

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.056
frontText: What are the two chart formatting ribbons?
backText: Chart Design and Format

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.057
frontText: How many total chart layouts can you choose from?

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.058
frontText: What settings can you create in a chart from the Format ribbon?
backText: Chart Area, Format Selection, and Reset To Match Style

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.059
frontText: How do you add a shape to a chart?
backText: Click the Format menu option, select the shape icon in the Format ribbon, and then click and drag the shape within the chart.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.060
frontText: What features can you apply to a shape?
backText: Shape styles, the shape fill, the shape outline, and shape effects

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.061
frontText: What is WordArt?
backText: Built‐in effects applied to text in Excel and other Microsoft Office applications

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.062
frontText: What features can you change in text?
backText: Fill, outline, and effects

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.063
frontText: When you have a chart selected, what happens when you click the Selection Pane icon in the Format ribbon?
backText: The Selection pane appears on the right side of the Excel window and shows you all the charts in the workbook.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.064
frontText: In what units can you change the height and width of a chart?
backText: Inches

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.065
frontText: How do you align multiple charts in a worksheet?
backText: Select the charts to align, click Align in the Format ribbon, and then select the alignment from the drop‐down menu.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.066
frontText: What is the only way that you can change the style for the entire chart?
backText: Selecting different color schemes

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.067
frontText: What is wrapping text?
backText: Telling Excel to keep the text within the width of the cell and have text that doesn’t fit within that width appear on separate lines

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.068
frontText: What is a data label in a chart?
backText: A number in the corresponding point or bar in the chart that is the corresponding value in the worksheet or table cell

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.069
frontText: What is a legend?
backText: A section that explains what each line or bar color represents in a chart.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.070
frontText: What is a trendline?
backText: A straight or curved line that shows the overall pattern of the data in the chart

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.071
frontText: What is Alt text?
backText: Alternative text that describes the chart

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.072
frontText: How much Alt text should you add?
backText: One or two sentences

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.073
frontText: What do you do to tell Excel that a chart doesn’t need Alt text?
backText: Select the Mark As Decorative check box in the Alt Text pane

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.074
frontText: What happens after you import a text or CSV file?
backText: A yellow bar appears above the worksheet that warns you about possible data loss if you save the worksheet in text format.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.075
frontText: How do you open the Find And Replace dialog box with the Replace tab active?
backText: Press Ctrl+H.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.076
frontText: What is a Screen Tip?
backText: A pop‐up box that appears when you move the mouse pointer over a hyperlink so that you know more about what the hyperlink does.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.077
frontText: How do you delete a hyperlink from a cell?
backText: Right‐click the link in the cell, and then click Remove Hyperlink in the context menu.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.078
frontText: What is the default paper size for a worksheet?
backText: Letter, or 8.5 inches by 11 inches

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.079
frontText: What happens when you resize a column using the mouse?
backText: The mouse pointer changes to a double‐headed arrow, and a pop‐up box appears above the pointer that shows you the width of the column.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.080
frontText: When you resize a row so that it’s larger than the height of the text, what does Excel do?
backText: Excel vertically aligns the text at the bottom of the row.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.081
frontText: How do you change the zoom setting in a worksheet?
backText: Click the View menu option, click the Zoom icon in the View ribbon, and then change the zoom setting in the Zoom dialog box.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.082
frontText: When you freeze the first row in a worksheet, how do you know the row is frozen?
backText: A darker line appears at the right edge of the first row.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.083
frontText: What are the four sections in the Paste drop‐down menu?
backText: Paste, Paste Values, Other Paste Options, and Paste Special

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.084
frontText: What are the three types of cell merges?
backText: Merge & Center, Merge Across, and Merge Cells

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.085
frontText: What happens when you rotate the alignment of text in a cell counterclockwise?
backText: You rotate the text 45 degrees.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.086
frontText: When you want to add a comma for numbers larger than 999, what do you do?
backText: In the Home menu ribbon, click the Comma Style icon in the Number section.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.087
frontText: What is the default font in a worksheet?
backText: 11‐point Calibri

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.088
frontText: Are cell names case sensitive?
backText: No.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.089
frontText: How do you clear conditional formatting in a worksheet?
backText: In the Home menu ribbon, click Conditional Formatting, move the mouse pointer over Clear Rules in the drop‐down menu, and then click Clear Rules From Entire Sheet.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.090
frontText: How do you convert a table into a cell range?
backText: Click a cell in the table, click the Table Design menu option, and then click Convert To Range in the Table Design ribbon.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.091
frontText: When you calculate StdDev in a total row, what are you doing?
backText: Calculating the standard deviation of all numbers in a column

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.092
frontText: What option do you choose in a selected total row cell drop‐down menu to calculate the total of all cells in the column?
backText: Sum

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.093
frontText: What are the three custom sorting methods?
backText: By column, by what you sort, and the sort order

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.094
frontText: What happens if you count a number in a cell in quotes when you use the COUNT() function?
backText: Excel counts that cell as if the number didn’t include quotes.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.095
frontText: What does the MID() function do?
backText: It returns a specific number of a string of characters in a cell.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.096
frontText: What is the difference between the CONCAT() and TEXTJOIN() functions?
backText: You can add a delimiter between text in two or more cells using the TEXTJOIN() function. With CONCAT(), you can’t use a delimiter.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.097
frontText: What is a delimiter?
backText: A blank space, comma, or other character or symbol that indicates the beginning or end of a character string

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.098
frontText: What happens when you size the column width using AutoFit?
backText: The column width changes to accommodate the text in the cell with the longest width.

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.099
frontText: What are the three worksheet views?
backText: Page Break Preview, Page Layout View, and Normal View

title: fc718246.MSOSExcelSG.100
frontText: What happens when you transpose data when you paste copied cells into a new range?
backText: Data in copied rows is pasted into columns and data in copied columns is pasted into rows.
